conbody.p: The Management Console is the web interface of . It allows administrators to manage the server.
conbody.note: The interface displays more options ansd settings for Administrators than it does for end users. Some of the features described below are only available in the Admin view.

On a micro cloud VM where the local network supports multicast DNS, the hostname will be . If you configured the hostname and DNS of the server manually, or if you connect to a server administered by someone else, supply the assigned hostname instead (for example, api.hcf-test.example.com).
To load Management Console, enter the URL into your web browser.
section.note:
Using a browser that supports WebSockets fully is recommended. The console is supported on the following browsers:
Chrome 30+ (WebKit)
Firefox 20+
IE 10+

section.title: Creating the First Administrative User
section.p: When you first access the Management Console, you will be prompted to create a primary administrative user for . Enter an email address as the username and enter a secure password, then review and accept the license agreement.
section.note: The password that you enter here becomes the password for the user on the VM (for example, for ssh access).

section.title: Customizing the Configuration
section.p: After you log in, you can add other users and administrators, enable and disable services, and customize the system according to your requirements.

Basic administration can be done through the Management Console, but some maintenance and configuration tasks may need to be done at the command line using the kato command. For a full list of options, see the Kato Command Reference.

The Management Console periodically sends non-identifying pingbacks ( version number and UUID) to Hewlett Packard servers to help us improve the web console experience. You can disable this by setting theme_settings['pingback_allowed']=false; in the settings.js file described in the Theming and Customization section.
